id.docs:
**[ID](https://esphome.io/guides/configuration-types.html#config-id)**: Set the ID of this sensor for use in lambdas.

*See also: [Duty Time](https://esphome.io/components/sensor/duty_time.html#configuration-variables)*

sensor.docs:
**[ID](https://esphome.io/guides/configuration-types.html#config-id)**: The ID of the `binary_sensor` to track the duty time. *May not be used with* `lambda`.

*See also: [Duty Time](https://esphome.io/components/sensor/duty_time.html#configuration-variables)*

lambda.docs:
**[lambda](https://esphome.io/automations/templates.html#config-lambda)**: Lambda that will be called in a loop to get the current state of the tracked object. *May not be used with* `sensor`.

*See also: [Duty Time](https://esphome.io/components/sensor/duty_time.html#configuration-variables)*

restore.docs:
**boolean**: Whether to store the intermediate result on the device so that the value can be restored upon power cycle or reboot. Warning: this option can wear out your flash. Defaults to `false`.

*See also: [Duty Time](https://esphome.io/components/sensor/duty_time.html#configuration-variables)*

last_time.docs:
Information of the last switch-on time sensor. All options from [Sensor](https://esphome.io/components/sensor/index.html#config-sensor).

*See also: [Duty Time](https://esphome.io/components/sensor/duty_time.html#configuration-variables)*

update_interval.docs:
**[Time](https://esphome.io/guides/configuration-types.html#config-time)**: The update interval. Defaults to `60s`.

*See also: [Duty Time](https://esphome.io/components/sensor/duty_time.html#configuration-variables)*

start.docs:
This action starts/resume time tracking. In lambdas, you may use the `start()` method.

*See also: [`sensor.duty_time.start` Action](https://esphome.io/components/sensor/duty_time.html#sensor-duty-time-start-action)*

stop.docs:
This action suspends time tracking. Causes the sensor to be updated, including the `last_time` sensor. In lambdas, you may use the `stop()` method.

*See also: [`sensor.duty_time.stop` Action](https://esphome.io/components/sensor/duty_time.html#sensor-duty-time-stop-action)*

reset.docs:
This action resets the duty time counter. Causes a sensor update. Does not affect the `last_time` sensor. In lambdas, you may use the `reset()` method.

*See also: [`sensor.duty_time.reset` Action](https://esphome.io/components/sensor/duty_time.html#sensor-duty-time-reset-action)*
